## Contract Description
The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is inviting interested suppliers to provide Elder Services to meet the needs of Indigenous offenders. The Elder will provide spiritual and cultural services, teachings, and ceremonies to Indigenous offenders, as well as provide guidance and counsel to staff and management.

## Objectives
The objective of this contract is to provide Indigenous programs and Elder services to the offender population, with the goal of assisting Indigenous offenders in their traditional healing journey and to further develop an understanding of traditional Indigenous culture.

## Key Responsibilities
* Provide ceremonial and spiritual services to Indigenous offenders
* Provide counseling and guidance to staff and management
* Attend case conferences and provide information to the Case Management Team
* Attend regional and national meetings as requested

## Assessment Criteria
Any interested supplier must demonstrate by way of a statement of capabilities that they meet the following requirements:

* Be recognized by their community as an Elder/Cultural Advisor
* Have a minimum of 5 years of experience delivering spiritual and cultural services to Indigenous people
* Be familiar with and able to conduct various ceremonies related to healing

## Notes
This procurement is set aside for Indigenous Suppliers in accordance with the Government Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business.
